data.title: Budget-Friendly Dependability!
data.body:
TL;DR: These AAA batteries deliver consistent power for everyday gadgets at a budget-friendly price. Ideal for standard use, though not the longest-lasting.

Amazon Basics AAA batteries are the go-to choice for everyday needs. They're like your trusty sidekick, offering dependable performance without breaking the bank.

In my experience, these batteries power through all sorts of devices, from remotes to smaller gadgets, without a hitch. They handle the basics with grace, giving you the juice you need.

However, if you're seeking marathon-level endurance, these AAA batteries might not be your champions. Like their AA siblings, their affordability means they might not last as long.

For everyday use in devices with reasonable power demands, they're a solid pick. They'll keep going without making a dent in your wallet. But if you've got power-hungry gadgets or need long-lasting stamina, consider splurging on higher-end options.

In a nutshell, Amazon Basics AAA batteries offer reliable performance for everyday tasks at an unbeatable price. While they might not win in the longevity department, their trustworthiness and affordability make them a smart choice for a wide range of household applications. ⚡🔋💡

data.title: Dependable Power on Demand: Amazon Basics 36-Pack AAA Alkaline Batteries
data.body:
As a frequent user of batteries in various household devices, I recently made the switch to the Amazon Basics 36-Pack AAA Alkaline High-Performance Batteries, and I couldn't be more satisfied with their performance. This bulk pack not only offers excellent value for money but also ensures that I have a reliable power supply on hand whenever I need it.

The standout feature of these batteries is their consistent high performance. With a voltage of 1.5 volts, they deliver a reliable and steady power output, making them suitable for a wide range of devices, from remote controls and flashlights to small electronic gadgets. I've experienced no issues with power fluctuations or unexpected failures, ensuring uninterrupted functionality for my devices.

One of the key selling points for me was the impressive 10-year shelf life. This feature provides long-term peace of mind, knowing that I can stock up on batteries without worrying about their effectiveness diminishing over time. It's a convenience that not only saves money in the long run but also ensures I always have reliable power within reach.

The durability of these batteries is commendable. They withstand the demands of high-drain devices without a significant drop in performance. Whether powering a camera during a special moment or keeping a child's toy running smoothly, the Amazon Basics AAA batteries have consistently delivered the necessary power.

I appreciate the eco-friendly design of these batteries, as they are free from harmful substances such as mercury and cadmium. This aligns with my commitment to sustainable choices, and it's reassuring to know that I can dispose of these batteries responsibly when the time comes.

The packaging of the 36-pack is simple and practical, allowing for easy storage while minimizing waste. The clear labeling and organized arrangement make it convenient to grab the right battery size when needed. The cost-effectiveness of buying in bulk, combined with the reliable performance, makes these batteries an excellent choice for everyday needs.

In conclusion, the Amazon Basics 36-Pack AAA Alkaline High-Performance Batteries with a 1.5-volt output and a 10-year shelf life are a smart investment for anyone seeking reliable, cost-effective power solutions. Whether for household gadgets or electronic toys, these batteries consistently deliver the performance and longevity I demand. I highly recommend them to fellow consumers looking for a dependable and budget-friendly battery option.

data.title: AAA work well
data.body: Ah, the trusty AmazonBasics batteries—the unsung heroes of our household! We used to swear by the Costco brand, but these Amazon beauties have won us over with their cheaper price point and surprisingly long lifespan. Whether it's AA, AAA, or any other size, they always come through when our toys start crying out for more juice. Plus, the convenience of adding them to our Amazon orders when we're running low is just unbeatable. If you've got a household full of battery-powered gadgets and gizmos, these babies are a must-have!

data.title: 7 brands, 1 test: results
data.body:
AmazonBasics batteries are quite good in terms of capacity -- pretty much tied for the top spot compared to the other 6 brands I've tested, but other brands have the edge in capacity per dollar. When I computed value by dividing capacity by the cost per battery of the cheapest package size, they took a respectable third place, and they have the advantage of being a trusted name compared to the value leader. In the images I have attached a graph and a table summarizing my test results for the 7 types I've tested, but if you'd like to know more about how I test ... on to the in-dept test & review.

I've been on a bit of a quest to test all of the top-selling aaa batteries on Amazon in a repeatable, precise way. This means the same equipment, same environmental conditions, and same slots in the equipment will be used for each test. For each test, I fully discharge 3 batteries in my Opus BT-C2000 battery analyzer at rates of 100 ma, 200 ma, and 400 ma (discharge rate affects usable capacity). I have also performed this exact same test (same equipment, same conditions) on the ACDelco, Duracell Procell, Duracell Coppertop, Energizer MAX, Maxell, and Rayovac. I have linked the other brands I've reviewed at the end of this review if you'd like to take a look at the other results for comparison purposes. For the Amazon Basics batteries, the capacity at each discharge rate was:

Disch Rt | Capacity | Runtime | Sample use case
100 mA | 997 mAh | 10 hrs | Low-power LED flashlight
200 mA | 914 mAh | 4.5 hrs | Electronic toy / medium LED flashlight
400 mA | 623 mAh | 1.5 hrs | Motorized toy / bright LED flashlight

Note that these (and all other Alkalines) would achieve somewhat higher capacity (maybe 1200 mAh) in a low discharge application like a mouse, keyboard, remote control, etc because alkaline batteries have internal resistance that reduces usable capacity at high discharge rates.

The capacity of these batteries is among the best I've tested -- take a look at the attached data table for comparative data. For the cost (~$0.31/ea in a 36 pack right now), these are a decent but beatable value -- the power supplied per dollar spent is very good, but eclipsed by other currently available options.

Comparison:

These batteries do well capacity-wise, but value-wise are blown away by the currently cheapest energy/dollar battery that I've tested, the ACDelco aaa's. Their capacity results were:

Disch Rt | Capacity | Runtime
100 mA | 1005 mAh | 10 hrs
200 mA | 864 mAh | 4.3 hrs
400 mA | 670 mAh | 1.7 hrs

As you can see, the Amazon batteries were very comperable ... but, at the current time the AmazonBasics batteries are $0.31/ea (36 pack), while the ACDelco batteries are about $0.21/ea (48 pack) -- so the ACDelco are significantly cheaper per mAh. I did not test shelf life, so it's possible that these may hold up better sitting in a drawer. Although both the Amazon batteries and the ACDelco batteries are certainly made on contract by a third party, I do think that I trust Amazon a bit more to provide consistent batteries than ACDelco ... although I haven't had any trouble with my ACDelco batteries so far. It's also worth noting that the Amazon batteries come in clearly superior packaging - while the ACDelco batteries come in a horrible gigantic plastic blister pack, the Amazon batteries come in a closable cardboard box. If you don't go through a lot of batteries & organization of your battery drawer is important to you, that could push them into the all-around winner category despite the ~50% price premium.

Finally, because another review specifically mentions the Rayovac AA's as being 'good' in some usage scenarios, I thought I'd share my findings for the Rayovac AAA's. In short, they're garbage - the Amazon batteries are better in EVERY case. It's possible that the Rayovac AA's are much better than the AAA's, but I think it's more likely that the version of the Rayovacs tested by the website that he got his results from is different than the most popular Rayovac on Amazon (I source all of my batteries from Amazon). I ran the Rayovac test several times because I couldn't believe how poorly they did ... here are some typical Rayovac results:

Disch Rt | Capacity | Runtime
100 mA | 908 mAh | 9 hrs
200 mA | 590 mAh | 2.9 hrs
400 mA | 443 mAh | 1.1 hrs

My other battery tests/reviews:

I have posted reviews for Duracell Coppertop, Duracell Procell and ACDelco aaa alkaline batteries with capacity data gathered using the exact same method and equipment. To find those reviews for comparison purposes, go to the product pages linked below and search for 'mah' under 'all reviews' (or just browse to them on my profile). If/when I do additional aaa tests/reviews in the future, I will update this list.

ACDelco AAA Super Alkaline Batteries
Duracell AAA Batteries Coppertop MN2400 - 20 Pack
Duracell Procell AAA Batteries PC2400BKD09
Energizer MAX AAA Batteries
Maxell Alkaline Battery AAA Cell
Rayovac Alkaline AAA Batteries

data.title: Better than expected
data.body: I use Amazon's batteries a lot. They're priced like the discount batteries, at least in this neighborhood, and they perform like the premium batteries. They last in remotes, even my X-Box controllers (well, the AA do anyway) a long time, and they have an excellent shelf life. I recently needed to pull out the last pack of AAA for an electric scale after those batteries had been sitting on the shelf since before the pandemic. They still worked and the scale registered them as fully charged. I bought a new box. These are great.

data.title: BATTERIES!!!
data.body: Amazon basic batteries are your basic run-of-the-mill mass manufactured type pre-charged, non rechargeable generic batteries that were probably rolled out of the same battery manufacturing plant as several other commercial brands - who knows? I speculate because the condition of the charge, the labeling, even the way they are so similarly packaged as others I have tried. Good deal. Cheap price.

data.title: Love the bundle!
data.body: The Amazon Basics 36-Pack AAA Alkaline High-Performance Batteries deliver reliable power for various electronic devices. With a voltage of 1.5 volts and a high-performance alkaline composition, these batteries are suitable for powering everything from remote controls to small gadgets. The impressive 10-year shelf life ensures longevity and reliability, making them a convenient choice for bulk purchases and storage. Designed as a cost-effective solution without compromising on quality, these AAA batteries from Amazon Basics provide a dependable power source for everyday devices, and the large pack size ensures you'll have an ample supply for all your household needs. Whether for household essentials or emergency preparedness, these batteries offer a durable and long-lasting energy solution.

data.title: Cheap and effective
data.body: Great price beats even costco. So many batteries for your buck and they last long.

data.title: Reliable Power Source for Everyday Needs
data.body:
The Amazon Basics 48-Pack AA Alkaline High-Performance Batteries stands out as a reliable and cost-effective solution for powering a wide range of devices in everyday life. With their impressive 1.5-volt output and extended 10-year shelf life, these batteries offer dependable performance whenever and wherever they're needed.

One of the key features of these batteries is their high performance. Whether I'm using them in remote controls, digital cameras, flashlights, or children's toys, I consistently experience long-lasting power and reliable performance. The 1.5-volt output ensures consistent energy delivery, minimizing the risk of device malfunctions or unexpected shutdowns.

Moreover, the 48-pack quantity provides excellent value for the price. With an ample supply of batteries on hand, I can easily swap out depleted batteries without worrying about running out of replacements. This bulk packaging not only saves money in the long run but also ensures that I always have spare batteries available for any situation.

Another standout aspect of the Amazon Basics AA batteries is their impressive 10-year shelf life. This extended lifespan means that I can confidently stock up on batteries without concern about expiration dates or loss of potency over time. Whether I use them frequently or store them for emergencies, I can trust that these batteries will maintain their performance when called upon.

The alkaline composition of these batteries further enhances their reliability and versatility. They perform well across a wide range of temperatures and environmental conditions, making them suitable for use indoors, outdoors, or even in demanding situations.

While the Amazon Basics AA batteries excel in most aspects, it's worth noting that they may not offer the same level of performance as premium brands in certain high-drain devices. In devices that require frequent battery changes or demand maximum power output, users may prefer specialized batteries tailored to their specific needs.

In conclusion, the Amazon Basics 48-Pack AA Alkaline High-Performance Batteries represents an excellent investment for anyone seeking reliable power sources for everyday devices. With their impressive performance, long shelf life, and affordable price point, these batteries have become a staple in my household, providing peace of mind and consistent power whenever I need it most.

data.title: Amazon Basics 36-Pack AAA Alkaline
data.body: for the price I paid for these batteries, it was well worth it. I've only use it in one thing so far, my Ring Mailbox sensor, but since I got the batteries, and installed them in the sensor, it's down to 72%. I am hoping that is normal for the VERY cold weather we had in January. This is Michigan, so, it's been in the 70s, 2 days later, in the teens, more that twice in the last 2 months... I shall see how much they last in the coming weeks.

data.title: Comparable to name brand
data.body: I used to use Energizer and Duracell before I found these batteries. I feel that these work just as good or better than them. I have kids and they have alot of toys that require batteries you can't beat these for the price. Definitely worth it. I will continue to buy.

data.title: Great Value
data.body: The batteries were packaged very well. I use them mostly in flashlights and remote controls, i have used them before and compared them with other name brand batteries and they seem to last as long and sometimes longer, so i will continue to use them, and recommend them to others.

data.title: Great value for the cost
data.body: Personally, I’ve never understood the difference between battery brands. To me they all do the same thing. These work just as well as any other battery I use and they are cheaper than buying the most expensive batteries at the store. The only complaint I’d have with these is the packaging sometimes isn’t the easiest to open/store. It can be a pain to open the individual sleeves without spilling the batteries all over the floor.

data.title: Batteries Gone Bad
data.body: I use to buy these all the time, but recently I have noticed they do not last as long as before, 2 each of AA and AAA recently. My last AAA box lost energy within a day in my candles. Normally they would last 3 or 4 weeks. So, will move on to major brand.

data.title: Batteries working well
data.body:
I needed for my tv remotes, and tempurpedic adjustable bed remote. All my remotes went at the same time and needed many
Batteries. They brought all my remotes back to life and everything working well. I have extras now should I need to replace.

data.title: LAST'S SO LONG!
data.body: I've purchased these multiple times over the years, and I must say, they out do every battery brand I've ever used. I have used everything from brand names, rechargeable, dollar store... you name it. I will always stand by Amazon Basics brand. And not to mention, the value! Super inexpensive and I rarely have to replace batteries the way I did with more popular name brands. Thank you Amazon!

data.title: Great to have a stash on hand
data.body: We have battery operated motion sensor light pucks on the stairs so we can trot downstairs without having to wake the whole house up with lights on. Between those, remote controls, toys, etc., we like have a bunch of batteries on hand. These are a great price and last long.

data.title: Power Up with Amazon Basics AAA Batteries: Affordable & Dependable!" 🔋💡
data.body: Let's talk about the Amazon Basics 36-Pack AAA Batteries – they're a lifesaver for all your electronic needs. First off, the convenience of having a hefty supply at hand is unbeatable, especially with the 36-pack. Pop them into your remotes, toys, or gadgets, and you're good to go. The performance? Pretty solid, I must say. They power up devices just as well as name-brand batteries, no hiccups there. However, I did notice that they may not last quite as long as some of the top-tier brands, but honestly, that's expected with generic options. Nevertheless, compared to other generic batteries I've tried, these ones hold their own pretty well. And considering the cost-effectiveness of buying in bulk, I'd say it's a minor trade-off. Overall, if you're looking for reliable batteries that won't break the bank, Amazon Basics AAA Batteries are the way to go.

data.title: Test these batteries….
data.body: Purchased the 36 count batteries October 2020. Today is January 20, 2024. Mainly use for my Amazon fire sticks. Which no doubt I would have them around for a while. Got a message on prime video this morning to replace batteries, and did so. Batteries did not work. Fished old Amazon batteries out of the garage. Guess what? They worked. Long and short. Spoke to three costumer service representatives before the last one determined he could issue me $10.00 gift card. Because the item was no longer replaceable or returnable. Which I did not want . I just wanted the batteries replaced. And not even the whole 36. Warranty states these batteries are supposed to have a 10 year shelf life. The first rep, overseas of course. Told me that only pertains to the packaging and not the batteries themselves. Why would I care about packaging that can last up to 10 years??? They talk to you like English is their first language and not yours. Anyway, I would strongly recommend if continuing to purchase these batteries, test them all at the time of delivery and get yourself a battery storage container.

data.title: Basic Batteries
data.body: These are your standard, basic batteries and some of the best prices I can find in my area. Local retailers carry all of the name brand and more than twice the price and I find I get about the same life span with Amazon Basics.

data.title: Good
data.body: Decent batteries. Only used them in tv remote and Thomas the trains for my son. Don’t seem to last longer or die faster than any other name brand battery. My son tends to leave his trains on until the battery dies. These are a great value

data.title: Amazing batteries
data.body: You get a good amount of batteries for the price, but not just that, the batteries are amazing they last (on my experience) same if not longer that the expensive brands. Delivery was very fast and all the batteries arrived in pristine condition. i use them on everything, toys, remotes, flashlights,... you name it. I will never buy another brand again...Thank you Amazon

data.title: Do the job!
data.body: For a cheaper price point, these batteries have done the job. You get an abundance so there are plenty of back up if they run out of juice. I have not found that these die faster than other brands. Would continue to purchase.

data.title: Value
data.body: Didn't want to spend $$ on name brand and thought I'd try these. Better than Dollar Store so hoping they'll be on par with your name brand ones. You get more while paying less so it's all good.

data.title: Super Convenient Battery Supply
data.body: Can't figure out how a battery-operated item knows when the household has used up all the ones needed for the remotes, etc. This solves the problem. They come well packaged and there were enough, I share them with extended family, included with birthday, etc. gift package. Amazing happy responses.

data.title: Not as long lasting as brand name but cheaper
data.body: Although not as long lasting as some other brands it gets the job done. For me personally an hour or so of extra battery life is not worth the extra dollar. These are a better value for what you get and they always arrive fast and on time.

data.title: I got what was ordered..
data.body: I got what was ordered and it was in good . The batteries were for the CD player that hasn’t arrived yet.. I’m pleased with the item overall!

data.title: Batteries worth their weight
data.body: Cut-rate batteries are sometimes not a bargain. However, this is not the case with the batteries available from Amazon. In hard use, they hold their own.

data.title: Cheap and work
data.body: I purchased Amazon batteries because they are easy to order at home, cheaper than other brands and work just fine. Haven't have any issues with these batteries.

data.title: Not sure what the longevity will be since we only just bought them.
data.body: Other than that, they work, come in a decent box that works for storing them. Sleeved in 15 or 20 count plastic sleeves so you don't have a mess of batteries rolling around and I'm not really sure what the rating for the 'Remote Control' feature is supposed to be for? Maybe because that is one of the many things you can put these batteries in? Anyway, in my previous experience the AAA rechargeable I've purchased end up getting thrown away prematurely, so I buy these. For AA I use rechargeable.

I used the batteries for every day items flashlights, remote seem to work great.
Certainly got more for my money great value!

data.body: I purchased Amazon AAA batteries because after purchasing Amazon AA batteries a few months ago the batteries are a good product. I also liked the low price for a pack of 8.

data.title: Good for the price. Shelf life not as advertised.
data.body:
I bought these about a year ago. The last month or two, my remote (among other things) has been chewing through these batteries. I used to only have to change them every few months, now its every few weeks. Nothing has changed in my usage. I'll still buy them but I may have to start buying less more often.

Batteries are stored in an environment between 66-71 degrees.

data.title: Very good- long lasting batteries that do not leak- months later.

Using these in outdoor garden timers- I definitely get worry- free use from them and also in my flashlights, etc. and many months later there has been no leakage at all- as I have had happen from other brand cheaper batteries and that came close to ruining my devices. The Amazon brand batteries are very well- made, are durable and long lasting- safely. Good quality and a great find!

And they're cheaper than just about anything else you can find. At least I haven't bought D or 9 volt batteries in years. Who needs smoke detectors?

Definitely nit picking, but at this point you'd think it would be wise to ship all together? The batteries work as expected.

My husband uses them in his trail cameras (which can get very expensive with as many batteries as those require and replacing them through a season) they do last as long as major brands.

data.title: 36 Pack of AAA batteries at a great price.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.body: After being loyal to big-name brands for so long, I hesitated to buy these batteries but was pleasantly surprised. They last much longer than I expected. Great buy. If you are on the fence, try it; I recommend it.

data.title: Great price for the product
data.body: I really loved the price for the product and thought it was well worth it. These were easy and convenient to order. I'll most likely only be buying batteries from amazon from now on.

data.title: Good batteraffordable gordable

data.title: Price in the length of the how long they work

data.title: Good value
data.body: I use these for my automatic soap dispenser, tv remotes, wall clocks, etc. Those device draw very little power and these batteries last months to years for me. I use rechargeable ones for high demand devices such as my gaming controllers. Overall I'm super happy with these. They're a good value for the 36 pack.

data.title: Just as great as the name brand batteries
data.body: This was my first time buying Amazon batteries but not my first experience with them. My old company use to use them and they last long but I usually buy the well known name-brand D or E brand. These last just long as the brand name D or E batteries but cost less. I will no longer pay more for those name brand batteries as I am now converted and will only buy Amazon brand from now on. I used these in my Christmas lights and it last the entire month of December; my lights were on timer and they came on everyday. I just took my lights down and the batteries as still good and can be used still which is normal for me with the name brand batteries and not store brand batteries. I’m happy to find alternatives so I can now save my wallet a bit. Definitely recommend!

data.title: Good for the pockets !
data.body: Great price and great quality. Plan to buy double A from this company. As a nurse a lot of my devices need batteries such as pulse ox and bp machine. Nurse approved !

data.title: Work perfect, long lasting
data.body: I love these batteries. They work just as long as any other, but don't cost a ton

data.title: Great value for the money!
data.body: Quite a bit less expensive than duracell, but they last almost as long. A good buy.

data.title: Must buy
data.body: These are a great price! My go to places for batteries! And they work great 👍

data.title: Majority are Alright
data.body: The first three batteries I used died in less than 24 hours. They were on for approximately three hours. They were used in a small tabletop decorative light. The next day when I turned on the light they were dead and had to be replaced. The batteries we have used since are still working.

data.title: If you need a lot of batteries - here you go!
data.body: When Christmas rolls around, everything light I have runs off batteries, so I HAVE TO BUY IN BULK! The store prices are crazy! I thought Amazon MUST have better prices and YUP! They do! You can't beat the pricing for 100 batteries and they lasted through the season. I still have some left! :) Pick them up so you can keep your electric payment down. It's really the only way to go.

data.title: Amazon AAA batteries
data.body: I use these for the battery operated light on my small aquarium. They last longer if a keep the light on dim. As soon as I put it on bright doesn’t last as long. Wish the battery life was longer! If you don’t mind changing batteries every couple of days then I would recommend!

data.title: Great value and long lasting
data.body: I have ordered the Amazon AA and AAA size brand batteries several times now for our home that we've lived n for the past seven years. All of our flameless candles, lanterns, gaming remotes, remotes, etc use them. They last a long time and are a great value for the amount you get.
